intro: Ranunculus hakkodensis, commonly known as the Hakkodé Ranunculus, is a rare flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and crowfoots. The plant is characterized by its delicate, usually yellow or white flowers with five petals and numerous stamens. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along streams. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
